thread.title: Taxes on Imported Luxuries

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Taxes on Imported Luxuries
text: IT will be remembered that the Home Government have decided to raise the duty on sugar by 1/2d. per lb and the duties on tea, cocoa, tobacco, coffee and chicory is to be increased by 3d. per gallon while that on patent medicines is to be doubled. Imported luxuries like motor cars, films, clocks, watches and musical instruments have to pay an ad valorem duty of 33 ½ per cent. When Mr. McKenna made the announcement it was stated that there was general satisfaction throughout the country at the manner in which taxation was spread. Mr. McKenna plainly stated that the sole object of Government was to raise revenue and check the import of luxuries. Nevertheless the extreme wing of free-trade politicians appears to have raised a debate in the House of Commons and attributed the scheme of taxation to the influence of tariff-reformers. The Premier deprecated the attempt at division and affirmed emphatically that free-trade questions were not involved in the scheme. He also reiterated that it was purely a war measure and was in nowise suggested by the Unionists.
